weekly_top_story.headline: Congress Reaches Deal To Avoid Trump Cuts, Boost HHS Spending
weekly_top_story.summary: Congress finalized a bipartisan FY2026 appropriations package boosting HHS funding to $116.6 billion while including key healthcare extenders like PBM reforms, Hospital at Home extensions, and telehealth flexibilities, stabilizing federal health programs amid budget pressures.

stories.headline: Medicaid Tries New Approach With Sickle Cell: Companies Get Paid Only if Costly Gene Therapies Work
stories.summary: Medicaid is piloting outcomes-based payments for sickle cell gene therapies, a strategy from the Biden era continued under Trump that could save costs and expand access to expensive treatments as more emerge.

stories.headline: Holland & Knight Health Dose: January 21, 2026
stories.summary: The White House released President Trump's 'Great Healthcare Plan' proposing ACA restructuring, expanded HSAs, drug pricing reforms like TrumpRx and PBM changes, alongside congressional PBM transparency and spread-pricing bans in new appropriations.
